Package ides.api.model.fsa

Interface FSAModel

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Annotable, DESModel, DESModelPublisher, FSAPublisher
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    FSASupervisor
    public interface FSAModel
extends DESModel, FSAPublisher
    Interface for models of Finite-State Automata.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void add​(FSAState s)
      Add a state.
      void add​(FSATransition t)
      Adds a transition the the automaton and adds the transition to the list of sources and targets in the source and target state of the transition.
      void add​(SupervisoryEvent e)
      Adds an event to the event set of the automaton.
      FSAState assembleCopyOf​(FSAState state)
      Assembles a new state with the same name and properties as the given state, which can then be added to the model.
      SupervisoryEvent assembleCopyOf​(DESEvent event)
      Assembles a new event with the same name and properties as the given event, which can then be added to the model.
      FSATransition assembleEpsilonTransition​(long source, long target)
      Assembles a new epsilon transition which can be added to the model.
      SupervisoryEvent assembleEvent​(java.lang.String symbol)
      Assembles a new event which can be added to the model.
      FSAState assembleState()
      Assembles a new state which can be added to the model.
      FSATransition assembleTransition​(long source, long target, long event)
      Assembles a new transition which can be added to the model.
      FSAModel clone()
      Creates and returns a copy of this FSAModel.

      Get the event with the given event id.

      Get the number of events in the event set of the FSA.

    • Method Detail

      • assembleState

        FSAState assembleState()
        Assembles a new state which can be added to the model. The state is not automatically added to the model.
        Returns:
        a new state

      • assembleCopyOf

        FSAState assembleCopyOf​(FSAState state)
        Assembles a new state with the same name and properties as the given state, which can then be added to the model. The state is not automatically added to the model.
        Parameters:
        state - the state whose properties are to be copied.
        Returns:
        A new FSAState with the same name and controllable and obsersable properties as the given state.

      • assembleEvent

        SupervisoryEvent assembleEvent​(java.lang.String symbol)
        Assembles a new event which can be added to the model. The event is not automatically added to the model.
        Parameters:
        symbol - the name for the event
        Returns:
        a new event with the given name

      • assembleCopyOf

        SupervisoryEvent assembleCopyOf​(DESEvent event)
        Assembles a new event with the same name and properties as the given event, which can then be added to the model. The event is not automatically added to the model.
        Parameters:
        event - the event whose properties are to be copied.
        Returns:
        A new FSAState with the same name as the given state. If the given event is a SupervisoryEvent, the new event will have the same controllable and observable properties as the given event.

      • assembleTransition

        FSATransition assembleTransition​(long source,
                                 long target,
                                 long event)
        Assembles a new transition which can be added to the model. The transition is not automatically added to the model.
        Parameters:
        source - the id of the source state of the transition
        target - the id of the target state of the transition
        event - the id of the event of the transition
        Returns:
        a new transition with the given properties
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the given source, target or event are not part of the model

      • assembleEpsilonTransition

        FSATransition assembleEpsilonTransition​(long source,
                                        long target)
        Assembles a new epsilon transition which can be added to the model. The transition is not automatically added to the model. An epsilon transition is a transition with no associated event (null). It is interpreted as a transition on the epsilon (empty) string.
        Parameters:
        source - the id of the source state of the transition
        target - the id of the target state of the transition
        Returns:
        a new transition with the given properties and no event
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the given source or target are not part of the model

      • add

        void add​(FSAState s)
        Add a state.
        Parameters:
        s - a state that needs to be added.

      • getStateCount

        long getStateCount()
        Get the number of states in the FSA.
        Returns:
        the number of states in the automaton

      • getTransitionCount

        long getTransitionCount()
        Get the number of transitions in the FSA.
        Returns:
        the number of transitions in the automaton

      • getEventCount

        long getEventCount()
        Get the number of events in the event set of the FSA.
        Returns:
        the number of events in the automaton

      • remove

        void remove​(FSAState s)
        removes the state from the automaton and all transitions leading to the state and originating from the state
        Parameters:
        s - the state to be removed

      • getStateIterator

        java.util.ListIterator<FSAState> getStateIterator()
        Get an iterator for the states in the FSA.
        Returns:
        a custom list iterator for the states

      • getState

        FSAState getState​(long id)
        Get the state with the given id.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the state
        Returns:
        the state, null if it doesn't exist

      • add

        void add​(FSATransition t)
        Adds a transition the the automaton and adds the transition to the list of sources and targets in the source and target state of the transition.
        Parameters:
        t - the transition to be added to the state

      • remove

        void remove​(FSATransition t)
        Removes a transition from the automaton. Removes the transition from the list of source transitions and the list of target transitions in the right states.
        Parameters:
        t - the transition to be removed

      • getTransition

        FSATransition getTransition​(long id)
        Get the transition with the given id.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the transition.
        Returns:
        the transition, null if the transition is not in the automaton.

      • getTransitionIterator

        java.util.ListIterator<FSATransition> getTransitionIterator()
        Get an iterator for the transitions in the FSA.
        Returns:
        a custom list iterator for the transitions.

      • add

        void add​(SupervisoryEvent e)
        Adds an event to the event set of the automaton.
        Parameters:
        e - the event that shall be added to the automaton.

      • remove

        void remove​(SupervisoryEvent e)
        Removes an event from the automaton.
        Parameters:
        e - the event to be removed

      • getEventIterator

        java.util.ListIterator<SupervisoryEvent> getEventIterator()
        Get an iterator for the events in the event set of the FSA.
        Returns:
        a custom list iterator for the events.

      • getEventSet

        SupervisoryEventSet getEventSet()
        Obtains the set of events in the model. If there are no events in the model, returns an empty set.
        Specified by:
        getEventSet in interface DESModel
        Returns:
        the set of events in the model.

      • getEvent

        SupervisoryEvent getEvent​(long id)
        Get the event with the given event id.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the event
        Returns:
        the event, null if it doesn't exist

      • clone

        FSAModel clone()
        Creates and returns a copy of this FSAModel.
        Returns:
        a copy of the model
